comments:
1) Download Platform
2) Using update manager, select JDT/PDE/VE/DTP/WTP, and click "add required"
3) Update
4) Grab some project from CVS that has a build.xml
5) Right-click build.xml and Open With -> Ant Editor

More data that randomly might be useful:

This is using a brand new workspace, but also using a separate target platform.

The target platform is the Platform M6 build from downloads.eclipse.org with a few other stock Eclipse plug-ins added.  I don't think this should matter, but in case it does, I'm including this info.

Odd.  I restarted Eclipse and the problem went away... :-(

Maybe related to grabbing from CVS???
If anything, this is a platform runtime issue.  Moving bug there for comment/closure.

David, did you apply the changes directly and then tried to open a build file, or did you restart eclipse after the install?
Were you running multiple copy of eclipse?
Can you reproduce it consistently?

Restart.
